tuv.seg: • How to apply • Where to apply
• Conas iarratas a dhéanamh
Jobseeker's Benefit is a weekly payment from the Department of Social Protection (DSP) to people who are out of work and are covered by social insurance (PRSI)
D'athraigh ainm na híocaíochta i 2006. Mura gcáilíonn tú le haghaidh Sochair Chuardaitheora Poist, d'fhéadfá le haghaidh Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist a cháiliú
If you don't qualify for Jobseeker's Benefit you may qualify for Jobseeker's Allowance
Is féidir an Réríomhán Tairbhe Oibre nua ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí a úsáid
Intreo - the integrated employment and support service
Intreo – an tseirbhís fhostaíochta agus tacaíochta comhtháite
Intreo is a service from the Department of Social Protection which provides a single point of contact for all employment and income supports
Seirbhís nua ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí is ea Intreo a soláthróidh pointe teagmhála aonair le haghaidh iomlán tacaíochtaí fostaíochta ioncaim
Details of Intreo locations are published on welfare.ie
Foilseoidh sonraí de na láithreacha nua ar welfare.ie
To qualify for Jobseeker's Benefit you must be aged under 66 and:
Chun a bheith i dteideal Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist ní mór duit a bheith faoi aois a 66 agus:
• Be unemployed (you must be fully unemployed or unemployed for at least 4 days out of 7)
• A bheith dífhostaithe, (caithfidh tú bheith as obair ar feadh 4 lá ar a laghad as 7 lá leanúnach oibre)
• Have had a substantial loss of employment and as a result be unemployed for at least 4 days out of 7
• Do fhostaíocht a bheith caillte agat agus a bheith as obair ar feadh 4 lá ar a laghad as 7 lá
• Be capable of work
• A bheith ábalta obair a dhéanamh
• Be available for and genuinely seeking work
• A bheith ag cuartú oibre agus a bheith ar fáil chun obair a dhéanamh
• Have enough social insurance (PRSI) contributions
• Do dhóthain ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC a bheith déanta agat

You can read more about the conditions for getting a jobseeker's payment and about the employment services the Department of Social Protection offers to jobseekers. There are some exceptions to the rules for pregnant women around the time of birth

Is féidir leat tuilleadh a léamh faoi na coinníollacha d’íocaíocht cuardaitheora poist a fháil agus faoi na seirbhísí fostaíochta a chuireann an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí ar fáil do chuardaitheoirí poist
Jobseeker's Benefit and work
Obair agus Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist
To get Jobseeker's Benefit you must be unemployed or have lost at least one day's employment and as a result be unemployed for at least 4 days out of 7 days

Chun a bheith i dteideal Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist ní mór duit bheith dífhostaithe nó lá fostaíochta amháin a bheith caillte agat agus a bheith as obair ar feadh 4 lá ar a laghad as 7 lá leanúnach oibre
You may continue to get Jobseeker's Benefit if you can only find part-time or casual work
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi obair agus Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist ar fáil
Where a Jobseeker's Benefit recipient is working for part of a week, their entitlement will be based on a 5-day payment week
Sa chás go bhfuil faighteoir an tSochair Chuardaitheora Poist ag oibriú ar feadh cuid den tseachtain, bunaítear a dteidlíocht ar sheachtain íocaíochta 5 lá
This means that for each day that a person is employed, 1/5th of the normal rate of Jobseeker's Benefit is deducted
Ciallaíonn seo go n-asbhaintear 1/5 den ghnáthráta den Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist ar feadh gach lá a bhíonn an duine sin fostaithe

If they get part-time work for 2 days, they will get 3/5ths of the normal Jobseeker's Benefit for that week and if they get part-time work for 3 days they will get 2/5ths of the normal rate of Jobseeker’s Benefit for the week

Má fhaigheann siad obair pháirtaimseartha ar feadh 2 lá, gheobhaidh siad 3/5 den ghnáthShochar Cuardaitheora Poist don tseachtain sin agus má fhaigheann siad obair pháirtaimseartha do 3 lá, gheobhaidh siad 2/5 den ghnáthráta den Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist don tseachtain
You must still be unemployed for at least 4 days out of 7 to claim Jobseeker's Benefit
Ní mór duit bheith dífhostaithe go fóill ar feadh 4 lá as 7 lá chun Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist a éileamh
You can read FAQS about these changes
Féadfaidh tú Ceisteanna Coitianta faoi na hathruithe seo a léamh anseo
There is an exemption from some of the rules for retained firefighters
Tá díolúine ó roinnt de na rialacha ar fáil do chomhraiceoirí dóiteáin coinnithe
More information is available about work and Jobseeker’s Benefit
Tá fáil ar thuilleadh faisnéise faoi Obair agus an Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist anseo

You must have suffered a substantial loss of employment in any period of 7 consecutive days to be eligible for Jobseeker's Benefit (casual workers and retained firefighters with no other employment are exempt from this rule)

Ní mór gur chaill tú méid suntasach fostaíochta in aon tréimhse 7 lá as a chéile chun bheith incháilithe do Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist (tá oibrithe ócáideacha agus comhraiceoirí dóiteáin coinnithe nach bhfuil aon phost eile acu díolmhaithe ón riail sin)
This means that you must have lost at least one day's employment and as a result of this loss be unemployed for at least 4 days out of 7
Ciallaíonn sé sin nach mór gur chaill tú fostaíocht aon lae amháin agus, mar thoradh ar an gcaillteanas sin, go mbeidh tú dífhostaithe ar feadh ceithre lá ar a laghad as gach seacht lá
Your earnings must also have been reduced because of the loss of employment
Ní mór gur tháinig laghdú ar do thuilleamh freisin mar thoradh ar an gcaillteanas fostaíochta
Social insurance (PRSI) contributions
Ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh (ÁSPC)
To qualify for Jobseeker's Benefit, you must pay Class A, H or P PRSI contributions
Chun a bheith i dteideal Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist ní mór duit ranníocaíochtaí rannóg A, H, nó P de ÁSPC a bheith íoctha agat
Class A is the one paid by most private sector employees
Íocann for mhór d'fostaithe sa rannóg phríomháideach ranníocaíochtaí isteach i rannóg A
Class H is paid by soldiers, reservists and temporary army nurses, who do not qualify for Jobseeker's Benefit until they have left the army
Íocann saighdiúirí, cúltacaí, agus banaltraí sealadach an airm, nach bhfuil i dteideal Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist go bhfágann siad an tarm, ranníocaíochtaí isteach i rannóg H
• At least 104 weeks PRSI paid since you first started work And
• Tá ort 104 seachtain de ranníocaíochtaí a bheith íoctha agat ó thosaigh tú ag obair
• 39 weeks PRSI paid or credited in the relevant tax year (a minimum of 13 weeks must be paid contributions*) Or
• Tá ort 39 ranníocaíochtaí a bheith íoctha agat nó a bheith creidiúnaithe duit sa bhliain cánach ábhartha (tá ort 13 den 39 ranníocaíochtaí ar a laghad a bheith agat*)
• 26 weeks PRSI paid in the relevant tax year and 26 weeks PRSI paid in the tax year immediately before the relevant tax year
• 26 ranníocaíochtaí a bheith íoctha agat sa bhliain cánach ábhartha agus 26 ranníocaíochtaí a bheith íoctha sa bhliain roimh an bhliain cánach ábhartha
*If you do not have 13 paid contributions in the relevant tax year, you must have paid 13 contributions in any of the following years:
* Mura mbíonn ort 13 ranníocaíocht a bheith íoctha agat sa bhliain chánach ábhartha tá ort na 13 ranníocaíocht a bheith íoctha agat in aon bhliain de na blianta seo leanas:
• The 2 tax years before the relevant tax year
• An dá bhliain chánach deireanach roimh an mbliain cánach iomchuí,
• The last complete tax year
• An bhliain chánach iomlán deireanach,
• The current tax year
• An bhliain chánach reatha
The relevant tax year is the second last complete tax year before the year in which your claim is made. So, for claims made in 2017, the relevant tax year is 2015
Is í an bhliain cánach ábhartha an dara bhliain dheireanach cánach roimh tús na bliana sochar, m.sh., i gcás éilimh a rinneadh i 2017, is é 2015 an Bhliain Chánach Ábhartha
There are a number of circumstances in which you can be awarded credited contributions
Tá roinnt cásanna ann go dtabharfar ranníocaíochtaí creidiúnaithe duit
For example, pre-entry credits are given when you start employment for the first time in your working life
Mar shampla, faigheann tú roinnt creidiúintí réamhiontráil nuair a thosnaíonn tú i bhfostaíocht don chéad uair
However, you can only qualify for Jobseeker's Benefit when you have actually paid 104 contributions
Ciallaíonn sé seo go bhfuil tú i dteideal Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist chomh luath agus atá 104 ranníocaíochtaí déanta agat
Credits are also awarded while you are getting certain social welfare payments, including Jobseeker's Benefit (provided it is for 6 days), Illness Benefit and, in some cases, Jobseeker's Allowance

Tugtar ranníocaíochtaí creidiúnaithe duit nuair a bhíonn tú ag tarraingt cinéalacha áirithe leasa shóisialaigh mar shampla, Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist (más do sé lá é), Líuntas Cuardaitheora Poist nó Sochar Breoiteachta
Contributions you have paid in other member states of the EU/EEA will be added to your Irish contributions
Tógtar san áireamh ranníocaíochtaí atá déanta agat in aon cheann de stáit an AE/LEE chomh maith leo siúd atá déanta in Éirinn agat
If you are applying for Jobseeker's Benefit and need the contributions paid in another EU/EEA country to help you qualify, then your last contribution must have been in Ireland
Má theastaíonn uait iarratas a dhéanamh ar Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist in Éirinn caithfidh na ranníocaíochtaí deireanacha bheith déanta in Éirinn agat
Under the Social Welfare (Consolidation) Act 2005 employers are obliged to register all employees for PRSI
Faoin Acht Leasa Shóisialaigh (Comhdhlúthú) 2005, tá dualgas ar an bhfostóir gach fostaí a chlárú do ÁSPC
Read more in our document on your Employer's duty to pay social insurance
Léigh tuilleadh inár gcáipéis ar Dhualgas an fhostóra árachas sóisialta a íoc
You may be disqualified from getting Jobseeker's Benefit for 9 weeks if you:
Beidh cosc curtha ort Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist a tharraingt go ceann 9 seachtaine má:
• Left work voluntarily and without a reasonable cause
• D'fhág tú an post go deonach agus gan cúis mhaith agat sin a dhéanamh
• Lost your job through misconduct
• Chaill tú an post toisc do mí-iompar féin
• Refused an offer of suitable alternative employment or suitable training - if you have been on a penalty rate of JB for at least 21 days
• Dhiúltaigh tú deis oiriúnach eile fostaíochta nó traenála
• Are aged under 55 and get a redundancy payment of more than €50,000
• Tá tú faoi aois 55 agus gur bhfuair tú íocaíocht iomarcaíochta níos mó ná luach €50,000
The exact length of your disqualification (up to 9 weeks) will depend on the amount of redundancy payment you received
Brathfidh an fhad a bheidh tú gan Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist (suas go 9 seachtainí) go díreach ar an méid íocaíocht scoir a fuair tú ag fágáil an phoist duit
If you are aged under 55 and get a redundancy payment of more than €50,000 you are disqualified from claiming Jobseeker's Benefit
Ar aghaidh, má tá tú faoi bhun 55 agus má fhaigheann tú íocaíocht iomarcaíochta atá os cionn €50,000 dícháileofar tú ó Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist a éileamh ar feadh na tréimhsí ama seo a leanas
The table below shows how long you may be disqualified for
Léiríonn an tábla thíos cé chomh fada a d’fhéadfá bheith dícháilithe
The length of the disqualification is at the discretion of the deciding officer (who can take your circumstances into account)
Cé gurb éigeantach dícháiliú a ghearradh, is faoi rogha an oifigigh chinntithigh an fad a mhairfidh an dícháiliú (ar féidir leis/léi do chúinsí a chur san áireamh)
Any period of disqualification is subtracted from your total Jobseeker's Benefit entitlement
Ba cheart duit a thabhairt faoi deara go mbaintear aon tréimhse dhícháilithe ó do theidlíocht iomlán i leith Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist

So if you are disqualified for 3 weeks (which is 18 days payment) your JB claim starts on day 19. Note that people who take voluntary redundancy and do not get a redundancy payment of over €50,000 can claim jobseeker's payments immediately
Mar sin, má bhíonn tú dícháilithe ar feadh 3 seachtaine (arb ionann seo agus íocaíocht 18 lá), tosóidh d’éileamh ar SCP ar lá 19
│Amount of redundancy payment │Period of disqualification │
│Méid na hÍocaíochta Iomarcaíochta │Tréimhse Dhícháilithe │
│€90,000.01 and over │9 weeks │
│€90,000.01 agus os a chionn │9 Seachtaine │
Duration of Jobseeker's Benefit
Fad an tSochair Chuardaitheora Poist
Jobseeker's Benefit is paid for 9 months (234 days) for people with 260 or more PRSI contributions paid
Má bhí níos lú ná 260 ranníocaíocht íoctha agat, d’fhéadfaí Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist a íoc leat ar feadh 9 mí (234 lá) ar a mhéid
It is paid for 6 months (156 days) for people with fewer than 260 PRSI contributions paid
Má tá tú faoi bhun 18 mbliana d’aois, ní bhfaighfeá Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist ach ar feadh 6 mhí (156 lá) ar a mhéid
There are some special provisions for older jobseekers
Is ann do roinnt forálacha speisialta do chuardaitheoirí poist scothaosta

People over 65 who are claiming Jobseeker’s Benefit (JB), and who have at least 156 PRSI contributions, can continue to receive JB until their 66th birthday even if their claim is due to end before that date

Daoine atá os cionn 65 bliain d’aois, atá ag éileamh Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist agus a bhfuil 156 ranníocaíocht ÁSPC ar a laghad déanta acu, is féidir leo leanúint le Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist a fháil go dtí go mbainfidh siad 66 bliain amach, fiú amháin i gcásanna ina bhfuil a n-éileamh le dul in éag roimh an dáta sin
For new JB claimants from 4 April 2013
Eilitheoirí nua ón 4 Aibreán 2013 ar aghaidh
│Number of contributions │Duration of JB claim │
│Líon na ranníocaíochtaí │Fad an éilimh ar SCP │
│260 or more │234 days (9 months) │
│260 nó níos mó │234 lá (9 mí) │
│Less than 260 │156 days (6 months) │
│Níos lú ná 260 │156 lá (6 mhí) │
Re-qualifying for Jobseeker's Benefit
Athcháiliú don Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist
You can re-qualify for JB if:
Féadfaidh tú athcháiliú don SCP má:
• You have used up your full JB entitlement (either 9 or 6 months)
• D’úsáid tú do theidlíocht iomlán SCP (cibé acu 9 nó 6 mhí)
• You have paid 13 PRSI contributions for at least 13 weeks (these contributions can be counted only after you have claimed at least 156 days (6 months) of JB)
• D’íoc tú 13 ranníocaíocht ÁSPC ar feadh 13 sheachtain ar a laghad (ní féidir na ranníocaíochtaí seo a chur san áireamh ach amháin tar éis duit 156 lá (6 mhÍ) den SCP a éileamh

However if you are working and claiming JB (systematic short-time workers and part-time workers) you cannot simply continue your JB claim when it is exhausted since you must have suffered a substantial loss of employment to re-qualify for JB, (unless you are a casual worker)

Má tá tú ag oibriú agus ag éileamh SCP (oibrithe córasacha gearrthréimhseacha agus oibrithe páirtaimseartha), áfach, ní féidir leat díreach leanúint le SCP a éileamh nuair a chuirtear deireadh leis, mar gheall gur gá go raibh tú thíos le mórchaillteanas fostaíochta chun athcháiliú don SCP, (murar oibrí ócáideach thú)
If you have lost your job you will have suffered a substantial loss of employment
Má chaill tú do phost beidh tú tar éis caillteanas suntasach fostaíochta a fhulaingt

If you are a part-time or systematic short-time worker DSP will look at your pattern of employment over the last 13 weeks or another representative period to find out whether you have suffered a substantial loss of employment

Más oibrí páirtaimseartha nó oibrí gearr-ama córasach tú breathnóidh an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí ar do phatrún fostaíochta le 13 seachtain anuas nó le haghaidh tréimhse ionadaíche eile chun fáil amach ar fhulaing tú caillteanas suntasach fostaíochta

For example, if you are getting JB and working 3 days each week as a systematic short-time worker or a part-time worker and your employment pattern has not changed during the course of your JB claim, you will not have suffered a substantial loss of employment and will not re-qualify for Jobseeker’s Benefit when you exhaust your claim

Mar shampla, má tá SCP á fháil agat agus má tá tú ag obair ar feadh 3 lá gach seachtain mar oibrí gearr-ama córasach nó oibrí páirtaimseartha agus murar athraigh do phatrún fostaíochta le linn d’éilimh ar SCP, ní bheidh caillteanas suntasach fostaíochta fulaingthe agat agus ní cháileoidh tú an athuair do Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist
However, if your JB claim ends and your 3 day week working week is then reduced to a 2 day week, you will have suffered a substantial loss of employment and may re-qualify for Jobseeker’s Benefit

Má thagann deireadh le d’éileamh SCP agus má laghdaítear do sheachtain oibre 3 lá go seachtain 2 lá, áfach, beidh caillteanas suntasach fostaíochta fulaingthe agat agus is féidir go gcáileodh tú an athuair don Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist
If you claim JB for a period, sign off and then claim JB again within 26 weeks your claim may be linked to the earlier claim
Má éilíonn tú SCP ar feadh tréimhse, má shíníonn den SCP agus má éilíonn tú SCP arís laistigh de 26 seachtain, d’fhéadfaí d’éileamh a nascadh leis an éileamh níos luaithe
This means that your claim is not treated as a new claim and:
Ciallaíonn seo nach gcaitear le d’éileamh mar éileamh nua, agus:
• You do not have to wait for 3 days before getting your payment
• Ní gá duit fanacht ar feadh 3 lá sula bhfaigheann tú d’íocaíocht
• The cumulative total of days from the previous claim is continued (so, for example, if you have used up 100 days of your total JB entitlement of 234 days you have 134 days remaining on your claim)
• Cuirtear san áireamh an t-iomlán carnach laethanta ón éileamh roimhe sin san áireamh (mar shampla, má d’úsáid tú 100 lá de do theidlíocht iomlán SCP de 234 lá, tá 134 lá fágtha agat ar d’éileamh)
• The rate of JB is the same rate payable as on the previous claim, unless there has been a budgetary increase or change in family circumstances (such as a new child dependant)
• Is ionann ráta an SCP agus an ráta a bhí iníoctha ar an éileamh roimhe sin, murar cuireadh méadú buiséadach i bhfeidhm nó murar tháinig athrú ar chúinsí teaghlaigh (ar nós cleithiúnaí nua linbh)
If your JB claim does not link to a previous claim it is treated as a new claim
Mura nasctar d’éileamh SCP le héileamh roimhe sin, caitear leis mar éileamh nua
You must wait for 3 days before getting a payment and your cumulative total of days starts from the first day of payment
Ní mór duit fanacht ar feadh 3 lá sula bhfaigheann tú íocaíocht agus tosaíonn do líon carnach iomlán laethanta ón gcéad lá fostaíochta

You can read more about linking claims including information on linking to a different scheme (such as Illness Benefit) and linking to an earlier JB claim through a different scheme or period spent in training or on an employment scheme

Féadfaidh tú níos mó a léamh faoi éilimh a nascadh ar láithreán gréasáin an RCS, lena n-áirítear faisnéis ar nascadh le scéim éagsúil (ar nós Sochar Breoiteachta) agus nascadh le héileamh SCP níos luaithe trí scéim éagsúil nó tréimhse a caitheadh faoi oiliúint nó i scéim fostaíochta
Short-term employment or training
Fostaíocht ghearrthéarmach nó oiliúint
The Department of Social Protection operates a fast-tracking system for people who sign off to take up work for a short period (up to 12 weeks) or to go on a short training course (up to 12 weeks)

Tá córas mear oibrithe ag an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí do chustaiméirí a shíníonn d’íocaíocht cuardaitheora poist chun obair ghearrthéarmach a ghlacadh (suas go 12 seachtaine) nó chun dul ar ghearrchúrsa oiliúna (suas go 12 seachtaine)
This ensures that your payment is re-instated without delay
Cinntíonn sé sin go n-atosófar d’íocaíocht gan mhoill
It is important that you inform your Intreo Centre or local Social Welfare Branch Office in advance that you are taking up work or training
Tá sé tábhachtach go ndéarfá le d’oifig leasa shóisialaigh áitiúil é roimh ghlacadh le hobair nó dul ar chúrsa oiliúna
Your Rent Supplement claim can also be suspended for up to 12 weeks
D’fhéadfadh d’éileamh ar Fhorlíonadh Cíos a chur ar fionraí ar feadh tréimhse suas le 12 seachtain
Jobseeker's Benefit is not paid for the first 3 days you are unemployed (the first 3 days are any 3 days, not necessarily consecutive, in a period of 7 consecutive days)
Ní íoctar Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist don chéad 3 lá den fhostaíocht bhriste. Séard is fostaíocht bhriste ann ná aon 3 lá (ní gá dóibh a bheith leanúnach) in aon tréimhse 7 lá leanúnach

If you are unemployed for a second time within 26 weeks of your last JB payment your application for Jobseeker's Benefit is not treated as a new claim and you do not have another 3 days of non-payment. See 'Linking claims' above
Má tharlaíonn dhá bhriseadh dá leithéid seo in aon tréimhse 13 seachtain níl aon bhriseadh san iarratas agus ní chaillfidh tú 3 lá eile gan íocaíocht
Weekly Jobseeker's Benefit payment in 2016 and up to 9 March 2017
Rátaí seachtainiúil maidir le Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist ó 9 Márta 2017
│Average weekly │Personal │Increase for a │Increase for a │
│Meánthuilleamh│Ráta │Méadú do Dhuine │Ardú │
│earnings │rate │qualified adult │qualified child │
│seachtainiuil │pearsanta│Fásta Cáilithe │Cleithiúnaí│
You get a personal rate and may get an increase for an adult dependant and child dependant (see below)
Gheobhaidh tú ráta pearsanta agus is féidir méadú do dhuine fásta cleithiúnach agus do leanbh cleithiúnach a fháil
Your average weekly earnings do not affect the amount you get for a child dependent
Ní bhíonn aon tionchar ar mhéadú do leanbh cleithiúnach ag do mheántuilleamh seachtainiúil
Jobseeker's Benefit rates are graduated according to your earnings in the relevant tax year
Tá rátaí Sochair Cuardaitheora Poist grádaithe de réir tuillimh sa bhliain cánach ábhartha d'éilimh
Your average weekly earnings are your gross yearly earnings from employment divided by the number of paid A, H or P contributions in the relevant tax year
Is é atá i do mheántuilleamh seachtainiúil ná d’olltuilleamh bliantúil ó fhostaíocht roinnte faoin líon ranníocaíochtaí A, H nó P atá íoctha sa Bhliain Chánach Ábhartha
The relevant tax year is 2 years before the year of your claim
Is an Bhliain Chánach Ábhartha í dhá bhliain roimh dháta d'éileamh
For example, if you claim Jobseeker's Benefit in 2017 the relevant tax year is 2015
Mar shampla, má tá tú ag éileamh Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist i 2017, is í 2015 an bhliain chánach ábhartha
If you only qualify for a reduced JB payment, it may of greater benefit for you to claim Jobseeker's Allowance instead of Jobseeker's Benefit
Má thagann tú isteach faoin riail seo b'fhéidir gur bhfearr duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist seachas ar Sochar an Chuardaitheora Poist
This increase is called an Increase for a Qualified Adult (IQA)
I gcásanna áirithe, is féidir éileamh ar SCP le héileamh níos sine a cheangal
If your adult dependant is earning €100 or less you will get the maximum IQA
Sa chás seo, ní bheidh d' éileamh SCP mar éileamh nua, beidh sé ceangailte le d' éileamh roimhe sin
If he or she is earning between €100 and €310 you will get a reduced rate of IQA
Má tá d'éileamh ceangailte le héileamh déanta is luaithe ná 2009 tá rátaí grádaithe mar a leanas:
If your JB claim is linked to a claim earlier than 2009 the following graduated rates apply:
Éilimh SCP a thosaigh i 2009
│Average weekly earnings │Personal rate │Qualified adult rate │
│Meánthuilleamh │Ráta │Méadú do Dhuine Fásta│
You can collect your Jobseeker's Benefit payment weekly from your nearest Post Office
Is féidir do Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist a bhailiú ón Oifig an Phoist is gaire duit gach seachtain
You must bring valid photographic identification (photo ID) with you to collect your payment
Ní mór duit aitheantas fótagrafach bailí a thabhairt leat chun d'íocaíocht a bhailiú
The following is regarded as valid photo ID:
Meastar na cáipéisí seo leanas mar aitheantas fótagrafach bailí:
Staff working in the Post Office may ask to see your photo ID before giving you your payment
Is féidir an fhoireann ag obair san Oifig an Phoist iarr ort d'aitheantas fótagrafach a fheiceáil roimh ag tabhairt d'íocaíocht duit
Taxation of Jobseeker's Benefit
Gearradh cánach ar Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist
Jobseeker's Benefit is taxable
Tá Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist inchánach
However, if you are getting Jobseeker's Benefit because your normal working week has been reduced temporarily (systematic short-time work) your Jobseeker's Benefit is not taxed
Áfach, má tá tú ag fáil Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist mar tá do sheachtain oibre giorraithe (obair ghearr-ama córasach), ní ghearrfar cáin ar do Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist
If you are working part-time and getting Jobseeker’s Benefit for the days you are not employed your Jobseeker’s Benefit is taxable
Leath-ráta Sochair Cuardaitheora Poist le híocaiocht leasa shoisialaigh eile
Find out more about the taxation of Jobseeker's Benefit and the taxation of JB for systematic short-time workers
Ní íocfar Méadú do leanbh Cleithúnach leat mar go bhfuil an íocaíocht a fháil agat orthu cheanna féin sa phríomh íocaíocht a fhaigheann tú
If you are getting Jobseeker's Benefit, you may be entitled to:
Má tá tú ag tarraingt Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist b'fhéidir go bhfuil tú i dteideal :
• Rent Supplement - a payment under the Supplementary Welfare Allowance scheme
• Forlíonadh Cíos - íocaíocht a fhaigheann tú ón Oifigeach Curam Pobail i do Ionad Sláinte áitiúil
• Back to School Clothing and Footwear Allowance - an allowance to help with the cost of uniforms and footwear for children who are attending school
Íoctar amach an scéim idir Mí Meitheamh agus mí Mean Fhómhair gach bliain - Déan teangmháil le d'oifig sláinte áitiúil
• Medical card - if your income is below a certain level, you may get a medical card
• Cárta Leighis - Má tá do ioncam níos ísle ná méid áirithe beidh tú i dteideal cárta leighis ón Roinn Sláinte
You do not qualify for the Household Benefits Package or Free Travel with Jobseeker’s Benefit
Má fhaigheann tú Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist, ní bheidh tú incháilithe le haghaidh Pacáiste Sochar Teaghlaigh nó Saor Thaisteal
You should apply for Jobseeker's Benefit the first day you become unemployed
Ba chóir duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist an chéad lá atá tú dífhostaithe
It is important to apply on the first day you become unemployed because you will not get paid for the first 3 days of your claim
Tá sé tábhachtach iarratas a dhéanamh an chéad lá dífhostaíochta toisc ní bheidh tú íoctha do na 3 lá d'éilimh tosaigh
Jobseeker's Benefit application forms are available online
Tá foirmeacha Sochair Cuardaitheora Poist ar fáil ar líne anois
You can also get an application form from your local Social Welfare Branch Office or Intreo Centre
Is féidir leat foirm iarratais a fháil ó d'oifig leasa shóisialaigh áitiúil
You will also need certain documents when you apply for Jobseeker's Benefit
Ní mór duit cáipéisí áirithe a thabhairt leat chun d'éileamh a chruthú
If you do not have these documents to hand, you should apply anyway and supply them later
Tá liosta na cáipéisí atá gá duit nuair tá tú ag déanamh iarratas ar Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist
You should remember that delay in applying for Jobseeker's Benefit may mean that you lose out on your full entitlements
Mura bhfuil na cáipéisí seo agat faoi láthair ba chóir duit iarratas a dhéanamh agus iad a fháil ina dhiaidh sin
You can get help to fill in your application form at your Intreo Centre, Social Welfare Branch Office or Citizens Information Centre
Ná déan dearmad má bhíonn tú déanach ag cur d'iarratas isteach ar Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist b'fhéidir go gcaillfeá roinn airgid dá bharr
More information is available in our document about signing on for the first time
Is féidir le d'oifig leasa shóisialaigh áitiúil nó Lárionad Faisnéise do Shaoránaigh cuidiú leat chun d'fhoirm iarratais a chomhlánú
If you think you have been wrongly refused Jobseeker's Benefit you can appeal the decision
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoi iarratas ar Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist ar fáil sa doiciméid maidir le ag siniú don chéad uair
You should apply for Jobseeker's Benefit to your Intreo Centre or Social Welfare Branch Office. Further information
Má cheapann tú go bhfuil sochar diúltaithe duit go héagórach, is féidir achomharc a chur
These half-rate payments were discontinued from February 2012
Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas?
Claimants getting Jobseeker's Benefit for 6 months or more on 3 April 2013 (or 3 months for people with fewer than 260 contributions) were not affected (see table below)
Ba chóír duit d'iarratas ar Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist a thabhairt isteach ag d'Ionad Intreo nó d'Oifig Bhrainse Leasa Shóisialaigh
